question.content: In 2018, Google Doodle celebrated the 100th birthday of Mrinalini Sarabhai. She is an exponent of which of the following dance forms?

solution.content: Bharatanatyam and Kathakali. Awards of Mrinalini Sarabhai - Padma Shri (1965), Padma Bhushan (1992), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1970), Dhirubhai Thakar Savyasachi Saraswat Award (2014), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1994). She was the founder of Darpana Academy of Performing Arts (1949).

question.content: Guru Bipin Singh, a Nrityacharya awardee, Sangeet Natak Akademi awardee and Kalidas Samman awardee, was renowned for promoting which classical dance form?

solution.content: Manipuri. Awards of Guru Bipin Singh Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1966), Kalidas Samman (1989), Title of Hanjaba by the Maharaja of Manipur. Famous Dancers: Manipuri - Yumlembam Gambhini Devi, Darshana Jhaveri, Nirmala Mehta.

question.content: Urmila Satyanarayanan is an exponent of which Indian classical dance form?

solution.content: Bharatanatyam. Urmila Satyanarayanan (Tamil Nadu) - Awards: Kalaimamani award (1997), Nritya Choodamani (2001).

question.content: Which of the given personalities is NOT associated with Carnatic Music?

solution.content: Vishnu Narayan Bhatkhande He was related to Hindustani classical music. Other personalities related to Carnatic music - Purandaradasa (Father of Carnatic music), Kanaka Dasa, Muthu Thandavar, Tyagaraja, Muthuswami Dikshitar, Syama Sastri, Aruna Sairam, Semmangudi Srinivasa lyer, Lalgudi Jayaraman.

question.content: Who was hailed as a resident dancer of Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanam for her unique contribution to the promotion of classical dance forms?

solution.content: Yamini Krishnamurthy. She is an Indian dancer of Bharatanatyam and Kuchipudi, recognised as "Asthana Nartaki" of the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanam. Awards - Padma Shri (1968), Padma Bhushan (2001) and Padma Vibhushan (2016). Uma Sharma (Kathak): Awards Padma Shri (1973), Padma Bhushan (2001).

question.content: Satyaram Reang received the Padma Shri for promoting the Hojagiri dance form. He belongs to which of the following states?

solution.content: Tripura. His Awards - Padma Shri (2021), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1986), Hojagiri dance (Reang community).

question.content: Who among the following Indian classical tabla players was called 'Abbaji'? He collaborated with American jazz drummer Buddy Rich to create a music album in 1968?

solution.content: Alla Rakha. He belongs to Punjab Gharana. Awards: Padma Shri (1977) and Sangeet Natak Academy Award (1982).

question.content: Who among the following personalities is associated with the musical instrument Mandolin?

solution.content: U Srinivas (Uppalapu Srinivas) He was an Indian mandolin player in Carnatic classical music. Awards: Padma Shri (1998), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2009).

question.content: Who among the following Kathak dancers of India founded the KADAMB Centre for Dance in 1964?

solution.content: Kumudini Lakhia: Award Padma Shri (1987), Padma Bhushan (2010), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1982), Kalidas Samman (2002-03).

question.content: Shivaputra Siddaramaiah Komkali math is the original name of which of the following Indian classical singers?

solution.content: Pandit Kumar Gandharva. Awards - Padma Vibhushan (1990). Pandit Jasraj (Rasraj) - Mewati Gharana.

question.content: Pandit Kishan Maharaj of Benaras Gharana was a player.

solution.content: Tabla. Awards of Kishan Maharaj Padma Shri (1973), Padma Vibhushan (2002).

question.content: V Satyanarayana Sarma, a Padma Shri awardee, was recognised for which of the following dance forms?

solution.content: Kuchipudi. Awards: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1961), Padma Shri (1970), Sangeet Natak Akademi Ratna (1967), Kalidas Samman (1988). Famous Dancers of Kuchipudi - Indrani Bajpai, Yamini Krishnamurthy, Lakshmi Narayn Shastri.

question.content: Padma Shri awardee, Darshana Jhaveri is a dancer of India.

solution.content: Manipuri. Darshana Jhaveri is the youngest of the four Jhaveri sisters (Nayana, Ranjana, Suverna, and Darshana). She is one of the founders of the Manipuri Narthanalaya established in 1972. Awards: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1996), Padma Shri (2002).

question.content: Ustad Hassu Khan was one of the founders of which of the following Gharanas of music?

solution.content: Gwalior Gharana: Oldest khayal gharana. Singers- Vishnu Digambar Paluskar, Nisaar Husain Khan, Ulhas Kashaalkar. Gharanas and their founders: Rampur - Ustad Inayat Hussain Khan, Agra Hajisujan Khan, Kirana Abdul Karim Khan.

question.content: Ramkrishna Talukdar received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2018 for his contribution to the Sattriya dance form. To which state does this dance form belong?

solution.content: Assam. Ramkrishna Talukdar : Awards - Asom Gaurav, Sangeet Jyoti Award, Nritya Ratna, Kala Gaurav. It was given the status of a classical dance in 2000 by the Sangeet Natak Akademi.

question.content: In which of the following cities of British India was Lata Mangeshkar born?

solution.content: Indore. Lata Mangeshkar She was India's playback singer and music composer. Awards: Padma Bhushan (1969), Padma Vibhushan (1999) and Bharat Ratna (2001), Maharashtra Bhushan Award (1997), Dadasaheb Phalke Award (1989). Titles: "Queen of Melody" and "Voice of the Millennium". First Song - 'Aayega aane wala' (1942, Mahal).

question.content: Akham Lakshmi Devi, a recipient of the Sangeet Natak Akademi award, is renowned for which of the following dances?

solution.content: Manipuri dance. Akham Lakshmi: Awards Sangeet Natak Akademi (2018), Manipur State Kala Akademi Award (2010).

question.content: Who was the founder of Benaras Gharana of Kathak?

solution.content: Janaki Prasad. Notable dancers Sitara Devi, Kamalini Asthana and Nalini Asthana. Ishwari Prasad - Founder of the Lucknow Gharana; Notable dancer Pandit Birju Maharaj. Shambhu Maharaj - Celebrated Guru of the Lucknow Gharana.

question.content: For contribution to which dance was Tanjore Balasaraswati awarded the title of Sangita Kalanidhi by Madras Music Academy in 1973? Graduate Level 27/06/2023 (Shift-4)

solution.content: Bharatnatyam. Tanjore Balasaraswati: Awards Sangeet Natak Academy Award (1955) and Padma Vibhushan (1977).

question.content: Shahid Parvez Khan, Budhaditya Mukherjee, Anushka Shankar and Hara Shankar Bhattacharya are well known players of which of the following instruments? Graduate Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 3)

solution.content: Sitar Plucked stringed instrument. Sitar players - Ravi Shankar, Annapurna Devi, Ustad Rais Khan and Ustad Abdul Jaffer Khan.

question.content: Which danseuse among the following was called to perform for Queen Elizabeth-Il's coronation festivities in 1953? Graduate Level 28/06/2023 (Shift -3)

solution.content: Kamala Lakshmi Narayanan (Bharatanatyam). Awards - Padma Bhushan (1970), Lifetime Achievement Award (2004), Natya Padmam (2007), Platinum Jubilee Award (2002).

question.content: Vasundhara Doraswamy was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (Akademi Puraskar) for the year 2019 for her contribution to which of the following? Graduate Level 30/06/2023 (Shift -1)

solution.content: а) Bharatanatyam (Tamil Nadu). She is the only Bharatanatyam danseuse to have been invited from India to perform for 'WORLD PEACE conference in Paris under the aegis of UNESCO. She was honoured with "Shantala Natya Sri Award" - The highest State Award for Dance by the Karnataka State Government and the Rajyotsava Award (Karnataka State).

question.content: Which dancer was the first person from Odisha to get Padma Vibhushan in 2000? Graduate Level 30/06/2023 (Shift- 1)

solution.content: Guru Kelucharan Mohapatra. Awards - Padma Bhushan (1988), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1966), Kalidas Samman (1987).

question.content: Jyoti Prasad Agarwala was a music composer popularly 'Rupkonwar' in the state of called Higher Secondary 27/06/2023 (Shift - 3)

solution.content: Assam. Jyoti Prasad Agarwal - First filmmaker of Assam. He made the first Assamese Movie 'Joymoti' (1935). His Famous Play- 'Sonit Konwari', 'Rupalim', 'Karengar Ligiri', 'Lobhita' and 'Joymoti'. His death anniversary (17 January) is observed as 'Silpi Divas' in Assam.

question.content: The noted danseuse Yamini Krishnamurthy opened Yamini School of Dance in in the year 1990. Higher Secondary 28/06/2023 (Shift - 2)

solution.content: Delhi. Yamini Krishnamurthy Awards Padma Shri (1968), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1997), Padma Bhushan (2001), Padma Vibhushan (2016), "Natya Shastra" award (2014). Autobiography - "A Passion For Dance".

question.content: Who among the following was the founder and director of the 'Darpana Academy of Performing Arts', an institute that focuses on training students in dance, drama, music and puppetry, in the city of Ahmedabad? Higher Secondary 30/06/2023 (Shift - 2)

solution.content: Mrinalini Sarabhai. Darpana Academy was founded in 1949 by Bharatanatyam and Kathakali dancer Mrinalini Sarabhai.

question.content: Who among the following personalities has received both Grammy and Oscar awards? Matric Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 1)

solution.content: Gulzar (Sampooran Singh Kalra) is a famous lyricist of Hindi films. Awards - National Film Award (1991, 1988). Filmfare Award (2021, 2019, 2013). Academy Award (2009). Padma Bhushan (2004). Jawed Akhtar: Poet and lyricist and screenwriter of Hindi films. Award: Padma Shri (1999), Padma Bhushan (2007).

question.content: Ratikant Mohapatra, an awardee of 'Sangeet Natak Akademi Award', is known for which of the following classical dances of India? Matric Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 1)

solution.content: Odissi (2016). Other Awards : Bhumiputra Samman (2016), Nritya Choodamani (2014). Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (Odissi) - Pankaj Charan Das (1970), Deba Prasad Das (1970), Mayadhar Raut (1985), Sonal Mansingh (1987), Kumkum Mohanty (1994), Gangadhar Pradhan (1997), Gita Mahalik (2009), Aruna Mohanty (2010), Sujata Mohapatra (2017), Surupa Sen (2018), Sutapa Talukdar (2019), Rabindra Atibudhi (2020).

question.content: Kamalini and Nalini Asthana, the dancer duo have been conferred with the Padma Shri in 2022. They are renowned for which of the following dance forms? Matric Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 2)

solution.content: Kathak. Kamalini Asthana and Nalini Asthana (Agra, Uttar Pradesh) known for their performances of the Benaras Gharana style of Kathak.

question.content: Surupa Sen is a famous dancer. Matric Level 28/06/2023 (Shift-4)

solution.content: Odissi. Awards of Surupa Sen: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2018), Raza Foundation Award (2006).

question.content: Who was the recipient of Ustad Bismillah Khan Yuva Puraskar 2017 for Kathak? Matric Level 30/06/2023 (Shift- 3)

solution.content: Vidha Lal. She is a disciple of Kathak dancer Geetanjali Lal of Jaipur Gharana. Awards: 'Sri Krishna gana sabha endowment award (2010) and Guinness world record for the most number of spins (103) in one minute (2011).

question.content: Papanasam Sivan was related to the following music? Matric Level 30/06/2023 (Shift-3)

solution.content: Carnatic. Papanasam Sivan Awards: Padma Bhushan (1972), Sangeet Natak Academy Fellow (1962), President Award (1962).

question.content: Who among the following musicians was awarded a Grammy in the Music Album category for his collaborative album 'Global Drum Project' along with Mickey Hart, Sikiru Adepoju and Giovanni Hidalgo? Matric Level 30/06/2023 (Shift -4)

solution.content: Zakir Hussain. Awards Padma Shri (1988), Padma Bhushan (2002), Padma vibhushan (2023) National Heritage Fellowship (1999), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1990), Kalidas Samman (2006), Guru Gangadhar Pradhan Lifetime Achievement Award (In 2012 at Konark Dance & Music Festival), Grammy Award (1992 and 2009).

question.content: Ilyas Khan was born in Lucknow to a family of musicians. He was famous for playing

solution.content: Sitar. Ilyas Khan (1924-1989) - He was a disciple of Abdul Ghani Khan (a dhrupad singer from Kalpi). His father belonged to the Shahjahanpur gharana of sarod players while his mother came from the Lucknow gharana of sarod players.

question.content: Pandit Shiv Kumar Sharma, an Indian musician and composer was the foremost exponent of the_

solution.content: Santoor. Pandit Shiv Kumar Sharma (Jammu and Kashmir) Awards Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1986), the Padma Shri (1991), and the Padma Vibhushan (2001).

question.content: Ustad Shafaat Ahmed Khan was best known for which of the following instruments?

solution.content: Tabla. Ustad Shafaat Ahmed Khan (Delhi gharana). Awards Padma Shri Award in 2003. Famous Tabla players - Zakir Hussain, Trilok Gurtu, Kishan Maharaj, Alla Rakha. Rudra Veena Player - Asad Ali Khan.

question.content: V. Satyanarayana Sarma was awarded with Padma Shri in 1970 for his contributions in the field of_ dance

solution.content: Kuchipudi - It originates from a village named Kuchipudi (Andhra Pradesh). Awards Padma Shri (1970), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1967), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1961), Kalidas Samman (1988).

question.content: Who among the following was awarded the Bharat Ratna in 2001 and has been credited with taking the shehnai from the marriage mandap to the concert hall?

solution.content: Bismillah Khan (Ustad). Awards: Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1956), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (1994), Swathi Sangeetha Puraskaram (1998) by Government of Kerala, T Choudayya National Award (1995) by Government of Karnataka, Tahar Mausique from the Republic of Iran (1992), Tansen Award by Govt. of Madhya Pradesh.

question.content: Who among the following was known as the 'Queen of Thumri'?

solution.content: Girija Devi. Awards - Padma Shri (1972), Padma Bhushan (1989), Padma Vibhushan (2016), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1977), Sangeet Natak Akademi Fellowship (2010).

question.content: A biopic on legendary Sitara Devi has been announced on her 101st birth anniversary by producer Raj C Anand. Sitara Devi was a recognized dancer.

solution.content: Kathak. Sitara Devi: Awards - Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1969), Padma Shri (1973), Kalidas Samman (1995).

question.content: Ustaad Allauddin Khan, a famous Indian musician is associated with musical instrument.

solution.content: Sarod. Awards- Padma Bhusan (1958), Padma Vibhushan (1971), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1954).

question.content: Saswati Sen is the proud recipient of the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for 2004-2005. She is recognized for which dance form?

solution.content: Kathak. Saswati Sen was a senior disciple of Pandit Birju Maharaj.

question.content: Who among the following was the first musician ever to be awarded the Bharat Ratna?

solution.content: M.S. Subbulakshmi is famous for carnatic music and the first Indian classical musician to perform at the United Nations General Assembly in 1966. Awards: Bharat Ratna (1998), Ramon Magsaysay Award (1974), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1956).

question.content: Who among the following was the first Indian musician to receive the Grammy LifeTime Achievement Award?

solution.content: Pandit Ravi Shankar (Bharat Ratna in 1999). He won Best Chamber Music Performance for 'West Meets East' in 1967. The Grammy Awards are presented annually by the Recording Academy of the United States. The first Grammy Awards ceremony May 4, 1959. Other Indian Grammy winners Zubin Mehta (1981, Best Classical Performance), T. H. Vinayakram and Zakir Hussain (1991, Best World Music Album), Vishwa Mohan Bhatt (1993, Best World Music Album).

question.content: Which of the following singer is the recipient of the Dadasaheb Phalke Award?

solution.content: Asha Bhosle She was honored with the Dadasaheb Phalke Award in 2000. Awards Padma Vibhushan (2008), Maharashtra Bhushan (2021). Awards: Sonu Nigam - Padma Shri (2022). First recipient of Dadasaheb Phalke Award was Devika Rani who received it in 1969.

question.content: Saroja Vaidyanathan received Kalidas Samman for classical dance in

solution.content: 2009-10. Saroja Vaidyanathan (Bharatanatyam). Her awards: Padma Bhushan (2013), Padma Shri (2002). Bharat Kala Sunder (2006). Book by her : "The Science of Bharatanatyam". The first recipients (1980) of the Kalidas Samman Semmangudi Srinivasa lyer (Classical music) and Mallikarjun Mansur (Classical Music).

question.content: Identify the famous Indian music personality. In 2011, the Guinness Book of World Records officially acknowledged her as the most recorded artist in music history.

solution.content: Asha Bhosle. She has recorded over 12000 songs in more than 20 Indian and foreign languages. The World Records Academy certified her as the "Most Recorded Artist" in the world in September 2009.

question.content: Lata Mangeshkar recorded her first playback song for a film.

solution.content: Marathi. Lata Mangeshkar She recorded her first song "Naachu Ya Gade, Khelu Saari Mani Haus Bhaari" in 1942 at age of 13 for Marathi film Kiti Hasaal and recorded her last song 'Saugandh Mujhe Is Mitti Ki' in 2019.

question.content: Alla Rakha left home at age 12 to learn a musical instrument under the great master (ustad) Mian Qadir Baksh. He became a renowned player of

solution.content: Tabla. Alla Rakha specialized in Hindustani classical music. He was born in Ghagwal (Jammu and Kashmir). He is a player of Tabla and Pakhawaj. Awards: Padma Shri (1977) and Sangeet Natak Akademi (1982).

question.content: Which among the following is not associated with Tabla?

solution.content: Shakoor Khan - Sarangi player, related to the Kirana Gharana. Padma Shri (1973).

question.content: Who popularised the 'Pandanallur Style' in Bharatanatyam and received Padma Bhusan in 2004?

solution.content: Alarmel Valli. She was the second youngest dancer to be conferred the Padma Shri (in 1991) from the Government of India, after Vyjayanthimala.

question.content: Who among the following is a celebrated sarod maestro?

solution.content: Zarin Sharma - She was a famous Sarod player of Khayal (Agra gharana). Award Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1988), Maharashtra Gaurav Puraskar (1990), Dadasaheb Phalke Academy award (2007).

question.content: The Indian classical dancer Sonal Mansingh was honoured with which of the following awards?

solution.content: Sonal Mansingh is an Indian classical dancer. She was the youngest recipient of the Padma Bhushan award in 1992. In 2003, she became the second Indian woman dancer to be honoured with the Padma Vibhushan, India's second highest civilian award, after Balasaraswati.

question.content: Vidushi Sharan Rani is famous for playing which musical instrument?

solution.content: Sarod. She is the first woman sarod player in India. She was awarded Padma Bhushan in 2000.

question.content: Who was popularly known as the Melody Queen in India?

solution.content: Lata Mangeshkar. (Nightingale of Bollywood, Voice of the Millennium).

question.content: Sri Deepak Mazumdar received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award for the year .

solution.content: 2018 (for his contribution to contemporary dance). Deepak Mazumdar: Founded - Shiladhish Art and Research Institute in Mumbai. Awards and honours - Maharashtra Gaurav; Kala Ratna (Andhra Pradesh), Acharya Nritya Sundaram by the Bharatanjali Trust (2007).

question.content: Who among the following was awarded with 'Padma Vibhushan' in the year 1986 and choreographed famous song 'Kahe Chhed Mohe' from the movie Devdas and 'Mohe Rang Do Laal' from Bajirao Mastani?

solution.content: Birju Maharaj. He was associated with the Kathak (classical dance of Uttar Pradesh) dance form. Sangeet Natak Akademi Awards (1964).

question.content: "Bombay" Ramnath is a famous_singer of India.

solution.content: Carnatic. Bombay Jayashri Ramnath (Padma Shri in 2021) has sung in multiple languages including Tamil, Telugu, Kannada. Famous Camatic singer - M. S. Subbulakshmi, S. Sowmya, M Balamuralikrishna, Nithyasree Mahadevan. Famous folk singers: Mame Khan, Swaroop Khan, Ila Arun, Nooran Sisters, The Wadali Brothers, Malini Awasthi, Dipali Borthakur, Kollangudi Karuppayee. Famous jazz singers: Shankar-Jaikishan, Trilok Gurtu, Louiz Banks. Famous hip-hop singers: Divine, Naezy, Raja Kumari, Brodha V.

question.content: Who among the following was awarded the prestigious title of "Nrityacharya' conferred by the Maharaja of Manipur?

solution.content: Guru Bipin Singh.

question.content: Who among the following is widely credited for introducing new forms of music, theatrical performance, language and the 'Sattriya' Dance?

solution.content: Srimanta Sankardev: He is widely credited with building on past cultural relics and devising new forms of music (Borgeet), theatrical performance (Ankia Naat, Bhaona), dance (Sattriya), literary language (Brajavali). Popular Sattriya Dancers - Guru Jatin Goswami, Ranjumoni Saikia, Guru Ghanakanta Bora, Manik Barbayan and Bhabananda Barbayan and Late Moniram Dutta.

question.content: Brij Bhushan Kabra is associated with which of the following musical instruments?

solution.content: Guitar. Brij Bhushan Kabra is related to the Jodhpur royal family. He was the first artist to play ragas on the guitar.

question.content: Who is noted as a pristine Indian Classical Dancer to perform at Salzburg Festival in 2015?

solution.content: Alarmel Valli: An exponent of the Pandanallur style of Bharatanatyam. Awards- Padma Bhushan (2004), Chevalier of Arts and Letters award (2004), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2001).

question.content: Jayanthi Kumaresh is one of the foremost exponents of

solution.content: Veena. Jayanthi Kumaresh is known for her mastery of the Saraswati veena, a plucked string instrument that is one of the most important instruments in Carnatic music. Awards - Sangeet shikhar samman award (2019); Music academy award (2015).

question.content: Ali Akbar Khan is associated with which of these instruments?

solution.content: Sarod. Ali Akbar Khan: Gharana - Maihar. He established a music school in Calcutta in 1956, and the Ali Akbar College of Music in 1967. He created Raag Chandranandan ('Moonstruck') in the 1940s. Awards - Padma Bhushan (1967) and Padma Vibhushan (1989).

question.content: In 2019, the Government of India honoured Milena Salvini, an Italian-born Kathakali dancer, with which of the following awards?

solution.content: Padma Shri. Milena Salvini Obtained a two-year scholarship to train in Kathakali at the Kerala Kalamandalam in 1962.

question.content: Nahid Siddiqui was awarded Milapfest's Lifetime Achievement Award in October 2017. She is recognized for which dance form?

solution.content: Kathak. Nahid Siddiqui (born in Pakistan), A disciple of two great teachers: Maharaj Kathak (Pakistan) and Birju Maharaj. Other Awards - Pride of Performance (1994), Time Out Award (1991), British Cultural Award, International Dance Award.

question.content: Which famous female personality received the Padma Shri award for Manipuri classical dance?

solution.content: Elam Endira Devi (Manipur). She is an Indian classical dancer and teacher. She performed in the film 'Matamgi Manipur', which won the National Film Award (1972). Other awards - Excellence Award, Nritya Rani Upadhi, Best Actress Award.

question.content: Indore gharana is one of the vocal gharanas of Indian classical music. It was founded by

solution.content: Ustad Amir Khan. Other disciples of Indore gharana - Pandit Amarnath, Shankar Lal Mishra, Kankana Banerjee, Purvi Mukherjee. Other gharana and its founder - Gwalior Khayal style (Ustad Nathan Pir Baksh), Agra (Hajisujan Khan), Rangeela (Faiyyaz Khan), Jaipur (Alladiya Khan).

question.content: Which famous Indian dancer was given the title of Asthana Narthaki ("Resident Dancer") by the Tirumala Tirupathi Devasthanam temple, India?

solution.content: Yamini Krishnamurthy.

question.content: Who among the following is not associated with the Kuchipudi dance form?

solution.content: Ghanakanta Bora Barbayan (Sattriya dance): Awards Padma Shri (2013), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2001).

question.content: Who among the following is a sitar maestro of global acclaim?

solution.content: Shahid Parvez Khan. Awards - Kalajyothi Lifetime Achievement Award (2020), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2006), Padma Shri Award (2012).

question.content: He is also known as the God of ghatam. Who is 'He' in the preceding line?

solution.content: TH Vinayakram. He is a percussionist and plays Carnatic music with the ghatam. Awards: Padam Shri (2002), Padam Bhushan (2014).

question.content: Which former Miss India, also the recipient of the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award, popularised Indian classical dance in the west?

solution.content: Indrani Rahman. She was the first South Asian to compete in the Miss Universe pageant (1952). Indrani was a successful classical dancer in Bharatanatyam, Kuchipudi, Kathakali and Odissi. In 1961, she became the first dancer to be a part of the Asia Society tour. Awards - Femina Miss India (1952), Padma Shri (1969), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (1981).

question.content: M.S. Gopalakrishnan mastered both Carnatic and Hindustani classical music. He was the master of_  (Afternoon

solution.content: Violin. Awards and Honours:- Padma Bhushan (2012), Padma Shri (1975), Sangeet Natak Akademi (1982), Sangeet Natak Akademi Tagore Ratna (2012), Kalaimamani (Tamil Nadu) - 1978.

question.content: Budhaditya Mukherjee is associated with which of the following musical instruments?

solution.content: Sitar. Budhaditya Mukherjee : First-ever musician to perform at the House of Commons, London.

question.content: Shri Mani Prasad is associated with which form of music?

solution.content: Hindustani vocal music. Pandit Mani Prasad was an Indian classical vocalist from the Kirana gharana (singing style). He was awarded Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2019. Hindustani music is the classical music of the Northern parts of the Indian subcontinent. Carnatic Music originated from Southern India, the city of Hyderabad and other Dravidian-speaking regions of India.

question.content: Shri Jatin Goswami received several honours for his contribution to

solution.content: Sattriya dance (Assam): Awards and Honours:- Padma Shri (2008), Sangeet Natak Akademi Award (2004), Silpi Divas Award (1994), Sangeet Jyoti Award (2004), Assam Natya Sanmilon Award (1997), Hiraprova Chandrakanta Award (2006).

question.content: With which of the following classical dance forms is Deepika Reddy associated?

solution.content: Kuchipudi (Classical dance of Andhra Pradesh): Guru Smt. Vijaya Prasad, Shri Vedantam Lakshmi Narayana Sastry, Dr. Vempati Chinna Satyam, Yamini Krishnamurthy, Shobha Naidu, Raja and Radha Reddy, Kaushalya Reddy, Yamini Reddy, Bhavana Reddy, Atisha Pratap Singh, Arunima Kumar.

question.content: The poet saint Kabir Das was born in sometime in the 15th century.

solution.content: Kashi (Uttar Pradesh). Kabir was a 15th century mystic poet, saint of the Bhakti Movement. Books - Bijak, Kabir Parachai, Sakhi Granth, and Kabir Granthawali. His verses are found in Sikhism's scripture Guru Granth Sahib. Saint Kabir was the contemporary of Guru Nanak and Delhi Sultan Sikandar Lodhi.

question.content: Aditi Mangaldas is a leading dancer & Choreographer in the classical Indian dance form of_

question.content: Abdul Karim Khan was the exponent of which school of Hindustani Music?

question.content: Which of the following music instruments are solid instruments?

solution.content: Ghana Vadya. Solid instruments are usually played with a striker or hammer. These instruments are not capable of producing definite pitches that are required for creating a melody. That is why their use is limited in classical music. Tata Vadya These are Stringed instruments. Avanaddha Vadya These are percussion instruments. Sushira Vadya- These are wind instruments. The Shehnai is a popular wind instrument in India.

question.content: The shehnai is a reed instrument with how many holes along the tubes?

solution.content: Seven. Shehnai - It is a reed instrument in which there are seven holes along the tube which are used for playing the melody by opening and closing them with the fingers. It is known as Mangal Vadya. It is considered to have come to India from West Asia. In the early fifties of this century, Ustad Bismillah Khan is credited for popularising this instrument. Pt. Anant Lal and Pt. Daya Shankar is also a noted Shehnai player.

question.content: What is Tat Vadya?

solution.content: Stringed instruments. Tata Vadya - Sound produced by vibration of a string or chord. Example - Veena, Sitar, Sarangi etc. The Percussion Instruments Congo, Bongo, Djembe, Darbukas, Hand Drums and Tongue Drums. Idiophones or Ghana Vadya are solid instruments that do not need any further tuning. Examples Piccolo, Manjira, Jaltarang, Jhanj and Chimta. Wind instruments - woodwinds, such as the flute, clarinet, oboe, and bassoon, also include brass instruments like horn and trumpet.

question.content: Flute instruments come under which type of instrument category?

solution.content: Sushira Vadya (Wind instrument). Example Flute, Shehnai, Nadaswaram. Ghana Vadya - Considered to be the world's first instrument. It does not require tuning. Example - Manjira, Khartal, Chimta, Ghatam, Jaltarang etc. Avanaddha Vadya - Sound produced by striking on animal skin. Example - Tabla, Mridangam, Dhol, Damru etc.

solution.content: Symbol of victory. Gudi Padwa: It is marathi new year. Gudi is made by tying a piece of fresh cloth around a bamboo stick of about 5 feet long and Marathis place neem leaves along with sugar candy garland on it. The stick is then placed in a silver or bronze pot. In Karnataka, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh this festival is also known as Ugadi. It is celebrated in the first month of Chaitra.

question.content: Which of the following statements is/are correct regarding the Hornbill Festival? A. The Hornbill Festival is celebrated in the North-eastern state of Nagaland. B.The festival takes place in the month of January. C. The name of the festival is derived from the Indian Hornbill, a bird that is an essential character of the folk tales of the state.

solution.content: Both A and C. Hornbill Festival is celebrated from 1 to 10 December in Nagaland. It is also called festivals of festivals.

question.content: Which of the following statements is/are correct regarding Bathukamma Festival? A. This festival is celebrated in the state of Telangana. B. solution.content: Only A, B and C.

question.content: What is the Malayalam New Year called in Kerala?

question.content: Moatsu festival of Nagaland is celebrated by which of the following tribes?

solution.content: Ao tribe. Moatsu Festival: Celebrated in the first week of May every year for 3 days. Other Tribal festivals of Nagaland - Hornbill Festival (Naga tribe), Sekrenyi (Angami tribe), and Aoleang (Konyak Nagas).

question.content: The Nuakhai festival of is observed on Panchami Tithi (fifth day) of the lunar fortnight of Bhadrava (August-September), the day after Ganesh Chaturthi.

solution.content: Diwali. question.content: Makaravilakku festival is celebrated in which of the following Indian states?

question.content: Which festival celebrated by Muslims is also known as Barawafat?

question.content: Which of the following harvest festivals is celebrated in Karnataka in the months of November-December?

question.content: Which among the following is the famous harvest festival of Meghalaya, India?

question.content: Which of the following gods/goddess is NOT associated with the Ratha Yatra festival of Puri, Odisha?

question.content: Dussehra festival is also known as

question.content: The Yaoshang festival of Manipur is celebrated for days.

question.content: Pongal, the four day Harvest festival is generally celebrated in

question.content: The Chhath Puja festival is dedicated to the God.

solution.content: Sun. Chhath Puja is celebrated in the Indian states of Bihar, Jharkhand, Uttar Pradesh, and Nepal. It is celebrated over four days in the month of Kartika according to the Hindu lunar Vikram Samvat calendar. The first day is Nahai Khai (day of fasting and bathing). The second day is Kharna (day of feasting). The third day is Sandhya Arghya (day of offering prayers to the setting sun). The fourth day is Usha Arghya (offering prayers to the rising sun).

solution.content: Baba Amte is the only Indian to have won the United Nations Award in the field of human rights in 1988.

question.content: Who was the first Asian player to win the Junior Wimbledon's Boys singles title?

solution.content: Ramanathan Krishnan was the first Asian tennis player to win the boy's singles title at Wimbledon Championship 1954 beating Ashley Cooper of Australia in the finals.

question.content: Who was India's first Chief of Defence Staff?

solution.content: General Bipin Rawat was India's first Chief of Defence Staff.

question.content: What is the name of the first research station in Antarctica built by the Government of India?

solution.content: Dakshin Gangotri was the first scientific base station of India situated in the Antarctic established in 1983.

question.content: The first Backward Classes Commission of India was headed by_.

solution.content: Kaka Kalelkar. The first Backward Classes Commission of India was set up by a Presidential Order in 1953 under the chairmanship of Kaka Kalelkar.

question.content: Name the first female amputee to climb Mount Everest.

solution.content: Arunima Sinha is the world's first female amputee to climb Mount Everest in 2013. She is also the first female amputee to climb Mount Vinson, the highest peak of Antarctica. is

question.content: Who is the first General of the Indian Army, whose retirement day celebrated as the 'Armed Forces Veterans Day' every year?

solution.content: General K.M. Cariappa. Armed Forces Veterans Day is observed each year on 14th January as a mark of respect and recognition of the services rendered by Field Marshal KM Cariappa, the first Indian Commander -in-Chief of the Indian Armed Forces who retired on 14 Jan 1953.

question.content: On which lake is the world's only floating post office situated?

solution.content: Dal Lake. The floating post office is located in the beautiful city of Srinagar in Kashmir, amidst picturesque snow-clad mountains on a huge houseboat in Dal Lake.

question.content: Sattriya dance form is famous in which of these states?

solution.content: Assam. Sattriya dance originated in Sattra, a monastery, as a part of the neo-Vaishnavite movement started by Srimanta Sankardev. Sattriya was given the status of a classical dance in the year 2000 by the Sangeet Natak Akademi. The dance styles of Sattriya are Paurashik Bhangi (male style) andStri Bhangi (female style). Folk dances ofAssam: Bihu, Bagurumba, Deodhani,Bhortal dance.
